headline: Disney Taps Formula 1's Global Fanbase To Supercharge Brand Reach Among Young Viewers
summary: Formula 1 and Walt Disney Co (NYSE:DIS) announced on Tuesday a new collaboration with Mickey & Friends that will begin in 2026. Formula 1 chief commercial officer Emily Prazer said the arrangement fits perfectly with its strategy to step outside the world of sport and into a broader consumer market. In return, it introduced Disney to its 820 million fans worldwide. In recent years, Formula 1 has seen a massive surge in growth with younger fans. Data shows that over four million children aged 8-1

headline: Disney seeks to stop YouTube from hiring veteran to oversee sports and media
summary: Disney filed a lawsuit against YouTube in a state court in Los Angeles late Wednesday to stop the appointment, alleging breach of contract, unfair competition and interference with a contractual relationship.  Disney claimed that YouTube is and has been aware of Connolly's employment agreement, which required him to work for Disney through at least March 1, 2027.

headline: AT&T CEO on potential Trump DEI pressure for $5.75B deal: 'We don't have to roll back anything'
summary: AT&T CEO John Stankey stops short of saying he will bend to any Trump administration demands on DEI if the company wants to close on a new $5.75 billion fiber deal.

headline: Universal launches new Epic Universe park, a $7B expansion
summary: Universal Orlando Resorts (CMCSA) opened its Epic Universe amusement park in Orlando, Florida, a $7 billion expansion that created five new "worlds" for parkgoers. Yahoo Finance senior reporter Allie Canal talks more about this launch and what it could mean for competitor, Disney (DIS). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.
